source_id.title: Source ID number
source_id.description: The PPS source id number for the observation. Only used for observations that result in individual sets of data extracted for multiple sources.
source_id.calculation: Copied from the MSA meta data file.

name.title: Slit name
name.description: The name assigned for the physical or virtual slit containing the source spectrum.

xsize.title: Slit size along axis 1
xsize.description: The size of the extracted slit region along axis 1 (pixels)

ysize.title: Slit size along axis 2
ysize.description: The size of the extracted slit region along axis 2 (pixels)

xstart.title: Slit starting pixel index along axis 1
xstart.description: The starting pixel index of the extracted slit region along axis 1 in the frame of the original image (pixels)

ystart.title: Slit starting pixel index along axis 2
ystart.description: The starting pixel index of the extracted slit region along axis 2 in the frame of the original image (pixels)

stellarity.title: Advised type of calibration processing for source
stellarity.description: Stellarity is a user entered keyword that provides a guideline for the calibration pipeline on how to calibrate the data: as a point or extended source with the value of -1 or a float between 0 and 1.

source_name.title: Source Name
source_name.description: The source name is assigned by the calibration software, based on source information contained in the NIRSpec MSA meta data file. The value is the concatenation of the program number and the source ID value (keyword SOURCEID), which is a unique integer value for each defined source within a program. The concatenated program and source id numbers are stored as a string value in the SRCNAME keyword.

source_alias.title: Source alias
source_alias.description: Users assign an alias to each source contained in a NIRSpec MSA planning tool source catalog. That source alias in turn gets stored in the alias field of the PPSDB nirspec_sources table, which then gets copied to the MSA meta data file produced by DMS level-1 processing. The calibration pipeline copies the alias value from the meta data file into the SRCALIAS keyword during level-2b processing.

source_type.title: Source type (point/extended)
source_type.description: iThe SRCTYPE keyword is used only for spectroscopic observations and gives the pipeline.s best guess as to whether the source is point, extended, or of an unknown type. This information can come from several different places upstream in the pipeline or the ground system. For spectroscopic observation modes that involve a single source, such as MIRI LRS, MIRI MRS, NIRSpec fixed-slit, NIRSpec IFU, and NIRISS SOSS, the user can enter the source type in the APT template for the observation. That choice gets passed along to DMS level-1 processing via the PPSDB and results in this keyword getting populated. For NIRSpec MSA observations, the user can enter this information for each source used in the MSA Planning Tool (MPT) in APT. These selections get stored in the PPSDB nirspec_sources table, which get copied to the MSA meta data file created by DMS and subsequently used as input to the level-2b calibration pipeline. The calibration pipeline copies the values from the MSA meta data file into the SRCTYPE keyword associated with each extracted MSA slitlet. In the event the user does not make a source type selection during APT processing for either of these two cases, the calibration pipeline will make default choices based on the observing mode. Finally, for the case of NIRCam and NIRISS Wide-Field Slitless Spectroscopy (WFSS) observations, source extents are determined by the calibration pipeline during level-2b processing of the direct images associated with a WFSS observation and stored in the resulting source catalog. During level-2b processing of the spectroscopic WFSS exposures, the information from the source catalog is used to populate the SRCTYPE keyword for each extracted source.

source_xpos.title: Source position in slit (x-axis)
source_xpos.description: The SRCXPOS keyword gives the estimated position of a source within a NIRSpec MSA shutter along the x-axis direction of the image, which is parallel to the dispersion direction and also corresponds to the narrow dimension of a shutter. Source positions run from 0x0 at the top left corner of a shutter, as seen projected on the sky, to 1x1 at the lower right corner of a shutter. The shutter center is therefore at 0.5x0.5. This value is estimated by the NIRSpec MSA Planning Tool and stored in the .estimated_source_in_shutter_x. field of the PPSDB nirspec_msa_metadata table. It is copied from the PPSDB table into the MSA meta data file created by DMS, and subsequently copied from the MSA meta data file by the calibration pipeline during level-2b processing and stored in the SRCXPOS keyword for each extracted MSA slit.

source_ypos.title: Source position in slit (y-axis)
source_ypos.description: The SRCYPOS keyword gives the estimated position of a source within a NIRSpec MSA shutter along the y-axis direction of the image, which is perpendicular to the dispersion direction and also corresponds to the long dimension of a shutter. Source positions run from 0x0 at the top left corner of a shutter, as seen projected on the sky, to 1x1 at the lower right corner of a shutter. The shutter center is therefore at 0.5x0.5. This value is estimated by the NIRSpec MSA Planning Tool and stored in the .estimated_source_in_shutter_y. field of the PPSDB nirspec_msa_metadata table. It is copied from the PPSDB table into the MSA meta data file created by DMS, and subsequently copied from the MSA meta data file by the calibration pipeline during level-2b processing and stored in the SRCYPOS keyword for each extracted MSA slit.

slitlet_id.title: Slitlet ID
slitlet_id.description: The slitlet id number assigned by the user in the NIRSpec MSA Planning Tool

shutter_state.title: Status of all shutters in the slitlet
shutter_state.description: A string value listing the open/closed status of all shutters that make up a given MSA slitlet, including an indication of which shutter is treated as the 'main' shutter for the slitlet (i.e. the nominal location of the source). There is one character per shutter that indicates whether the shutter is closed ('0') or open ('1'), and the main shutter is indicated by the character 'x'. For example, a slitlet composed of 5 open shutters with the main shutter being in the middle is represented by the string '11x11'.

slit_ra.title: [deg] Right Ascension at middle of slit
slit_ra.description: [deg] Right Ascension at the middle of the slit.

slit_dec.title: [deg] Declination at middle of slit
slit_dec.description: [deg] Declination at the middle of the slit.
